1{-# LANGUAGE FlexibleInstances #-}
2{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
3
4-- | Parser for token tree.
5
6module Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.TTree.Parse
7  ( -- * Type
8    Tree, TTree, NamedTrees,
9
10    -- * Parser
11    ToTrees (..),
12    ttreeGroup,
13    withTrees,
14    readClauseTrees,
15
16    -- * Pretty print
17    treesDoc, ppTrees,
18  ) where
19
20import qualified Text.PrettyPrint                        as P
21import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base                    as B
22import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Token            as S
23import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.TTree.Bracket    as S
24
25
26-- --------------------------------------------  Type
27
28-- | Tree of tokens.
29type Tree = B.CodeTree S.BracketType S.Token
30
31-- | Tree of tokens.
32{-# DEPRECATED TTree "Use 'Tree' instead." #-}
33type TTree = Tree
34
35-- | Pair of token trees and its name.
36type NamedTrees = B.Named [Tree]
37
38-- | Wrap trees in group.
39ttreeGroup :: [Tree] -> Tree
40ttreeGroup = B.treeWrap S.BracketGroup
41
42-- --------------------------------------------  Parser
43
44-- | Convert to token trees.
45class ToTrees a where
46    -- | Convert to list of token trees.
47    toTrees :: a -> B.Ab [Tree]
48
49    -- | Convert to token tree.
50    toTree :: a -> B.Ab Tree
51    toTree a = ttreeGroup <$> toTrees a
52
53    -- | List of token trees or error.
54    toTrees' :: a -> [Tree]
55    toTrees' = B.unabort . toTrees
56
57    -- | Token tree or error.
58    toTree' :: a -> Tree
59    toTree' = B.unabort . toTree
60
61instance ToTrees String where
62    toTrees = tokenTrees . S.toks
63
64instance ToTrees [S.Token] where
65    toTrees = tokenTrees
66
67instance ToTrees [Tree] where
68    toTrees = Right
69
70-- | Parse tokens with brackets into trees.
71--   Blank tokens and comments are excluded.
72tokenTrees :: [S.Token] -> B.Ab [Tree]
73tokenTrees = B.trees S.getBracketType B.BracketNone . S.prepareTokens
74
75-- | Call function with token trees.
76--
77--   >>> withTrees id "a"
78--   Right [TreeL (TText /0.1.0/ TextRaw "a")]
79--
80withTrees :: (ToTrees a) => ([Tree] -> b) -> a -> B.Ab b
81withTrees f a =
82    do ts <- toTrees a
83       Right $ f ts
84
85-- | Read clauses and convert to token trees.
86readClauseTrees :: FilePath -> B.IOAb [[Tree]]
87readClauseTrees path =
88    do toks' <- S.readClauseTokens path
89       return $ case toks' of
90         Right toks -> mapM toTrees toks
91         Left a     -> Left a
92
93-- --------------------------------------------  Pretty print
94
95-- | Convert token trees to 'B.Doc' value for pretty printing.
96treesDoc :: [Tree] -> B.Doc
97treesDoc = dv where
98    dv = B.pprintV . map d
99    d (B.TreeL x) = B.pprint "|" B.<+> B.pprint x
100    d (B.TreeB br oc xs) =
101        let tag   = "<" ++ B.name br ++ ">"
102            treeB = B.pprint tag B.<+> brackets oc
103        in P.hang treeB 2 $ dv xs
104
105    brackets Nothing = B.pprint ""
106    brackets (Just (open, close)) =
107        B.pprintH [B.pprint open, B.pprint "--", B.pprint close]
108
109-- | Pretty print token trees.
110--
111--   >>> ppTrees "a ( b c )"
112--   | TText /1.0/ TextRaw "a"
113--   <group> TOpen /1.2/ "(" -- TClose /1.8/ ")"
114--     | TText /1.4/ TextRaw "b"
115--     | TText /1.6/ TextRaw "c"
116--
117ppTrees :: (ToTrees a) => a -> IO ()
118ppTrees a = case toTrees a of
119              Left ab   -> putStrLn `mapM_` B.abortMessage [] ab
120              Right ts  -> print $ treesDoc ts
